Tamilnadu.
Scribal hands: (U1, U2, U3) Tamil script. Incised, soot.
cover: the = front cover. U1: 1 folio = Ñāṉakkuṟaḷ by Auvaiyār: Title Page. Double folio. No foliation. Recto more dark = original outside page. U2: 1 folio = Ñāṉakkuṟaḷ by Auvaiyār: TBC. No foliation. U3: 31 folios = Ñāṉakkuṟaḷ by Auvaiyār: Text. Tamil foliation 1-31. U4: 1 folio = guard leaf. Double folio. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Verso more dark = original outside page. cover: the = front cover.
Palm leaf (Pothi. 1 stringhole.) leaf: 35 × 200 mm. object: 35 × 200 × 35 mm. The kuṟaḷs are grouped in tens with an intertitle and distributed kuṟaḷ-wise (5 numbered kuṟaḷs par page).
Mahogany woodcovers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

scopecontent.p:
Transcription conventions
() indicates unclear text. ¿? indicates sic erat scriptum. [] indicates supplied text. {} indicates a note. [vacat] indicates the scribe deliberately left a space. […] indicates an ellipsis. Transliteration conventions: Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Abbreviations: c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.

acqinfo.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).
Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.
